str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From archomai; a commencement, or chief.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Perfectness, perfection, maturity. From teleios; completeness.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) mid: I lay, of a foundation, (b) met: I cast down, prostrate. From kata and ballo; to throw down.
Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.
From a derivative of tithemi; something put down, i.e. A substruction.
From metanoeo; compunction; by implication, reversal (another's) decision).
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
And, even, also, namely.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
